FILE COPY^; :nt8 fesf- ^c^rl /< iMM^TATt- [B^LAIR] 12 SEP 1942 , DSPiulTi;!ENTAL KO. 2 PROM JBDDA TO FOREIGN OFFICE Mi'.“'Stonehevrer Bird D» Untimed, 26th August, 1942 No, 6 SAVING R. 4.45 p.m. 11th September,. 1942 ^ «“ St ' 1942 'Wihi Scc^t^y. Repeated to Government of India No» _ ■X- h'] ^ fa »K**f Aden No, 1, . ,7'. Minister of State, Cairo No, 13, G*icu<4J>L M- Bagdad No. 1, ^ hJ*. Beirut No. 1, Jerusalem No. 1 and Ai/AL Khartoum No. 1. (ALL SAVING). n ^ . ifc.ix. kkkkk Ibn Saud has informed me that a number of destitute Yemenis and Hadramis have recently entered Saudi Arabia*- In present economic and financial condition of his country Ibn Saud cannot allow such persons to settle and in future only., those foreign subjects who have means of subsistence will be admitted* Ibn Saud asks assistance of British authorities in the matter* I have replied that I will inform all authorities concerned* As regards territories north of Hejaz control can be exercised by Saudi representatives. As regards Aden Protectorate and the Sudan it would I feel be most difficult to ensure that no person devoid of means left for the Hejaz but a warning could perhaps be issued in these territories.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Ext 4986/42 Destitute Yemenis and Hadhramis entering Saudi Arabia'

physicalDescription.extent: There is only one letter within the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from the British Ministry at Jedda to the Foreign Office, informing them that Ibn Saud had asked for assistance in preventing destitute Yemenis and Hadramis from entering Saudi Arabia, requesting that only subjects with means of subsistence be admitted.

name.namePart: King of Saudi Arabia 'Abd al-'Azīz bin 'Abd al-Raḥmān bin Fayṣal Āl Sa'ūd
